94.name: Spirit Torch
94.description: It's unclear where the blue color comes from...

475.name: Potato Seeds
475.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature, and has a chance of yielding multiple potatoes at harvest.

484.name: Radish Seeds
484.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 6 days to mature.

480.name: Tomato Seeds
480.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

487.name: Corn Seeds
487.description: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 14 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

494.name: Beet Seeds
494.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 6 days to mature.

262.name: Wheat
262.description: One of the most widely cultivated grains. Makes a great flour for breads and cakes.

427.name: Tulip Bulb
427.description: Plant in spring. Takes 6 days to produce a colorful flower. Assorted colors.

79.name: Secret Note
79.description: It's old and crumpled, but if you look closely you can make out the details...

476.name: Garlic Seeds
476.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.

228.name: Maki Roll
228.description: Fish and rice wrapped in seaweed.

610.name: Fruit Salad
610.description: A delicious combination of summer fruits.

770.name: Mixed Seeds
770.description: There's a little bit of everything here. Plant them and see what grows!

270.name: Corn
270.description: One of the most popular grains. The sweet, fresh cobs are a summer favorite.

589.name: Trilobite
589.description: A long extinct relative of the crab.

618.name: Bruschetta
618.description: Roasted tomatoes on a crisp white bread.

24.name: Parsnip
24.description: A spring tuber closely related to the carrot. It has an earthy taste and is full of nutrients.

212.name: Salmon Dinner
212.description: The lemon spritz makes it special.

486.name: Starfruit Seeds
486.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 13 days to mature.

579.name: Prehistoric Scapula
579.description: Commonly known as a "shoulder blade"... It's unclear what species it belonged to.

268.name: Starfruit
268.description: An extremely juicy fruit that grows in hot, humid weather. Slightly sweet with a sour undertone.

309.name: Acorn
309.description: Place this on your farm to plant an oak tree.

256.name: Tomato
256.description: Rich and slightly tangy, the Tomato has a wide variety of culinary uses.

597.name: Blue Jazz
597.description: The flower grows in a sphere to invite as many butterflies as possible.

453.name: Poppy Seeds
453.description: Plant in summer. Produces a bright red flower in 7 days.

628.name: Cherry Sapling
628.description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature cherry tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

685.name: Bait
685.description: Causes fish to bite faster. Must first be attached to a fishing rod.

631.name: Peach Sapling
631.description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Peach tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

461.name: Decorative Pot
461.description: A replica of an ancient pot.

612.name: Cranberry Candy
612.description: It's sweet enough to mask the bitter fruit.

417.name: Sweet Gem Berry
417.description: It's by far the sweetest thing you've ever smelled.

299.name: Amaranth Seeds
299.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to grow. Harvest with the scythe.

229.name: Tortilla
229.description: Can be used as a vessel for food or eaten by itself.

244.name: Roots Platter
244.description: This'll get you digging for more.

284.name: Beet
284.description: A sweet and earthy root vegatable. As a bonus, the leaves make a great salad.

595.name: Fairy Rose
595.description: An old folk legend suggests that the sweet smell of this flower attracts fairies.

648.name: Coleslaw
648.description: It's light, fresh and very healthy.

590.name: Artifact Spot
590.description: Uh... how did you get this in your inventory? Ape made a booboo.

488.name: Eggplant Seeds
488.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

485.name: Red Cabbage Seeds
485.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 9 days to mature.

278.name: Bok Choy
278.description: The leafy greens and fibrous stalks are healthy and delicious.

481.name: Blueberry Seeds
481.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 13 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

429.name: Jazz Seeds
429.description: Plant in spring. Takes 7 days to produce a blue puffball flower.

252.name: Rhubarb
252.description: The stalks are extremely tart, but make a great dessert when sweetened.

400.name: Strawberry
400.description: A sweet, juicy favorite with an appealing red color.

728.name: Fish Stew
728.description: It smells a lot like the sea. Tastes better, though.

241.name: Survival Burger
241.description: A convenient snack for the explorer.

727.name: Chowder
727.description: A perfect way to warm yourself after a cold night at sea.

731.name: Maple Bar
731.description: It's a sweet doughnut topped with a rich maple glaze.

310.name: Maple Seed
310.description: Place this on your farm to plant a maple tree.

211.name: Pancakes
211.description: A double stack of fluffy, soft pancakes.

272.name: Eggplant
272.description: A rich and wholesome relative of the tomato. Delicious fried or stewed.

273.name: Rice Shoot
273.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 8 days to mature. Grows faster if planted near a body of water. Harvest with the scythe.

632.name: Pomegranate Sapling
632.description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Pomegranate tree. Bears fruit in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

274.name: Artichoke
274.description: The bud of a thistle plant. The spiny outer leaves conceal a fleshy, filling interior.

493.name: Cranberry Seeds
493.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 7 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

266.name: Red Cabbage
266.description: Often used in salads and coleslaws. The color can range from purple to blue to green-yellow depending on soil conditions.

376.name: Poppy
376.description: In addition to its colorful flower, the Poppy has culinary and medicinal uses.

311.name: Pine Cone
311.description: Place this on your farm to plant a pine tree.

258.name: Blueberry
258.description: A popular berry reported to have many health benefits. The blue skin has the highest nutrient concentration.

483.name: Wheat Seeds
483.description: Plant these in the summer or fall. Takes 4 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.

607.name: Roasted Hazelnuts
607.description: The roasting process creates a rich forest flavor.

477.name: Kale Seeds
477.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 6 days to mature. Harvest with the scythe.

300.name: Amaranth
300.description: A purple grain cultivated by an ancient civilization.

473.name: Bean Starter
473.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 10 days to mature, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

633.name: Apple Sapling
633.description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Apple tree. Bears fruit in the fall. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

239.name: Stuffing
239.description: Ahh... the smell of warm bread and sage.

280.name: Yam
280.description: A starchy tuber with a lot of culinary versatility.

250.name: Kale
250.description: The waxy leaves are great in soups and stir frys.

232.name: Rice Pudding
232.description: It's creamy, sweet, and fun to eat.

178.name: Hay
178.description: Dried grass used as animal food.

583.name: Prehistoric Rib
583.description: Little gouge marks on the side suggest that this rib was someone's dinner.

788.name: Lost Axe
788.description: Robin's been looking everywhere for it.

198.name: Baked Fish
198.description: Baked fish on a bed of herbs.

215.name: Pepper Poppers
215.description: Spicy breaded peppers filled with cheese.

276.name: Pumpkin
276.description: A fall favorite, grown for its crunchy seeds and delicately flavored flesh. As a bonus, the hollow shell can be carved into a festive decoration.

490.name: Pumpkin Seeds
490.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 13 days to mature.

188.name: Green Bean
188.description: A juicy little bean with a cool, crisp snap.

421.name: Sunflower
421.description: A common misconception is that the flower turns so it's always facing the sun.

584.name: Prehistoric Vertebra
584.description: A segment of some prehistoric creature's spine.

649.name: Fiddlehead Risotto
649.description: A creamy rice dish served with sauteed fern heads. It's a little bland.

479.name: Melon Seeds
479.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 12 days to mature.

282.name: Cranberries
282.description: These tart red berries are a traditional winter food.

815.name: Tea Leaves
815.description: The young leaves of the tea plant. Can be brewed into the popular, energizing beverage.

190.name: Cauliflower
190.description: Valuable, but slow-growing. Despite its pale color, the florets are packed with nutrients.

789.name: Lucky Purple Shorts
789.description: Better not inspect these too closely.

304.name: Hops
304.description: A bitter, tangy flower used to flavor beer.

802.name: Cactus Seeds
802.description: Can only be grown indoors. Takes 12 days to mature, and then produces fruit every 3 days.

457.name: Pale Broth
457.description: A delicate broth with a hint of sulfur.

790.name: Berry Basket
790.description: The fibers are stained with berry juice.

248.name: Garlic
248.description: Adds a wonderful zestiness to dishes. High quality garlic can be pretty spicy.

588.name: Palm Fossil
588.description: Palm Fossils are relatively common, but this happens to be a particularly well-preserved specimen.

730.name: Lobster Bisque
730.description: This delicate soup is a secret family recipe of Willy's.

302.name: Hops Starter
302.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 11 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

591.name: Tulip
591.description: The most popular spring flower. Has a very faint sweet smell.

271.name: Unmilled Rice
271.description: Rice in its rawest form. Run this through a mill to increase the value.

347.name: Rare Seed
347.description: Sow in fall. Takes all season to grow.

264.name: Radish
264.description: A crisp and refreshing root vegetable with hints of pepper when eaten raw.

227.name: Sashimi
227.description: Raw fish sliced into thin pieces.

593.name: Summer Spangle
593.description: A tropical bloom that thrives in the humid summer air. Has a sweet, tangy aroma.

489.name: Artichoke Seeds
489.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 8 days to mature.

491.name: Bok Choy Seeds
491.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 4 days to mature.

745.name: Strawberry Seeds
745.description: Plant these in spring. Takes 8 days to mature, and keeps producing strawberries after that.

201.name: Complete Breakfast
201.description: You'll feel ready to take on the world!

431.name: Sunflower Seeds
431.description: Plant in summer or fall. Takes 8 days to produce a large sunflower. Yields more seeds at harvest.

478.name: Rhubarb Seeds
478.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 13 days to mature.

208.name: Glazed Yams
208.description: Sweet and satisfying... The sugar gives it a hint of caramel.

351.name: Muscle Remedy
351.description: When you've pushed your body too hard, drink this to remove 'Exhaustion'.

98.name: Dwarf Scroll III
98.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a blue rope.

580.name: Prehistoric Tibia
580.description: A thick and sturdy leg bone.

582.name: Skeletal Hand
582.description: It's a wonder all these ancient little pieces lasted so long.

102.name: Lost Book
102.description: Writings from a wide variety of time periods.

342.name: Pickles
342.description: A jar of your home-made pickles.

425.name: Fairy Seeds
425.description: Plant in fall. Takes 12 days to produce a mysterious flower. Assorted Colors.

260.name: Hot Pepper
260.description: Fiery hot with a hint of sweetness.

629.name: Apricot Sapling
629.description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Apricot tree. Bears fruit in the spring. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

482.name: Pepper Seeds
482.description: Plant these in the summer. Takes 5 days to mature, and continues to produce after first harvest.

606.name: Stir Fry
606.description: Julienned vegetables on a bed of rice.

472.name: Parsnip Seeds
472.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 4 days to mature.

608.name: Pumpkin Pie
608.description: Silky pumpkin cream in a flakey crust.

455.name: Spangle Seeds
455.description: Plant in summer. Takes 8 days to produce a vibrant tropical flower. Assorted colors.

581.name: Prehistoric Skull
581.description: This is definitely a mammalian skull.

474.name: Cauliflower Seeds
474.description: Plant these in the spring. Takes 12 days to produce a large cauliflower.

71.name: Trimmed Lucky Purple Shorts
71.description: Purple silk shorts trimmed in luxurious gold...

433.name: Coffee Bean
433.description: Plant in spring or summer to grow a coffee plant. Place five beans in a keg to make coffee.

30.name: Lumber
30.description: A versatile resource used for building and fuel.

301.name: Grape Starter
301.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to grow, but keeps producing after that. Grows on a trellis.

492.name: Yam Seeds
492.description: Plant these in the fall. Takes 10 days to mature.

630.name: Orange Sapling
630.description: Takes 28 days to produce a mature Orange tree. Bears fruit in the summer. Only grows if the 8 surrounding "tiles" are empty.

733.name: Shrimp Cocktail
733.description: A sumptuous appetizer made with freshly-caught shrimp.

599.name: Sprinkler
599.description: Waters the 4 adjacent tiles every morning.

107.name: Dinosaur Egg
107.description: A giant dino egg... The entire shell is still intact!
sources: Prehistoric Floors in the Skull Cavern

552.name: Malachite
552.description: A popular ornamental stone, used in sculpture and to make green paint.

709.name: Hardwood
709.description: A special kind of wood with superior strength and beauty.

380.name: Iron Ore
380.description: A fairly common ore that can be smelted into bars.

586.name: Nautilus Fossil
586.description: This must've washed up ages ago from an ancient coral reef.

406.name: Wild Plum
406.description: Tart and juicy with a pungent aroma.

567.name: Marble
567.description: A very popular material for sculptures and construction.

553.name: Neptunite
553.description: A jet-black crystal that is unusually reflective.

275.name: Artifact Trove
275.description: A blacksmith can open this for you. These troves often contain ancient relics and curiosities.

382.name: Coal
382.description: A combustible rock that is useful for crafting and smelting.

378.name: Copper Ore
378.description: A common ore that can be smelted into bars.

373.name: Golden Pumpkin
373.description: It's valuable but has no other purpose.

20.name: Leek
20.description: A tasty relative of the onion.

220.name: Chocolate Cake
220.description: Rich and moist with a thick fudge icing.

154.name: Sea Cucumber
154.description: A slippery, slimy creature found on the ocean floor.

159.name: Crimsonfish
159.description: Lives deep in the ocean but likes to lay its eggs in the warm summer water.

721.name: Snail
721.description: A wide-ranging mollusc that lives in a spiral shell.

551.name: Lunarite
551.description: The cratered white orbs form a tight cluster.

585.name: Skeletal Tail
585.description: It's pretty short for a tail.
sources: Tilling in The Mines or Skull Cavern

568.name: Sandstone
568.description: A common type of stone with red and brown striations.

415.name: Stepping Stone Path
415.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

143.name: Catfish
143.description: An uncommon fish found in streams.

705.name: Albacore
705.description: Prefers temperature "edges" where cool and warm water meet.

724.name: Maple Syrup
724.description: A sweet syrup with a unique flavor.

799.name: Spook Fish
799.description: The huge eyes can detect the faint silhouettes of prey.

265.name: Seafoam Pudding
265.description: This briny pudding will really get you into the maritime mindset!

725.name: Oak Resin
725.description: A sticky, fragrant substance derived from oak sap.

371.name: Quality Retaining Soil
371.description: This soil has a good chance of staying watered overnight. Mix into tilled soil.

384.name: Gold Ore
384.description: A precious ore that can be smelted into bars.

464.name: Flute Block
464.description: Plays a flute sound when you walk past.

766.name: Slime
766.description: A shimmering, gelatinous glob with no smell.

811.name: Napalm Ring
811.description: When you defeat an enemy, they explode.

132.name: Bream
132.description: A fairly common river fish that becomes active at night.

545.name: Fluorapatite
545.description: Small amounts are found in human teeth.

549.name: Jagoite
549.description: A high volume of tiny crystals makes it very glittery.

297.name: Grass Starter
297.description: Place this on your farm to start a new patch of grass.

140.name: Walleye
140.description: A freshwater fish caught at night.

4.name: Stone
4.description: A useful material when chopped with the axe.

576.name: Slate
576.description: It's extremely resistant to water, making it a good roofing material.

116.name: Dried Starfish
116.description: A starfish from the primordial ocean. It's an unusually pristine specimen!

438.name: L. Goat Milk
438.description: A gallon of creamy goat's milk.

525.name: Sturdy Ring
525.description: Cuts the duration of negative status effects in half.

706.name: Shad
706.description: Lives in a school at sea, but returns to the rivers to spawn.

796.name: Slimejack
796.description: He's coated in a very thick layer of slime. He keeps slipping out of your hands!

169.name: Driftwood
169.description: A piece of wood from the sea.

331.name: Weathered Floor
331.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

416.name: Snow Yam
416.description: This little yam was hiding beneath the snow.

555.name: Nekoite
555.description: The delicate shards form a tiny pink meadow.

572.name: Soapstone
572.description: Because of its relatively soft consistency, this stone is very popular for carving.

105.name: Chewing Stick
105.description: Ancient people chewed on these to keep their teeth clean.

573.name: Hematite
573.description: An iron-based Mineral with interesting magnetic properties.

682.name: Mutant Carp
682.description: The strange waters of the sewer turned this carp into a monstrosity.

267.name: Flounder
267.description: It lives on the bottom, so both eyes are on top of its head.

749.name: Omni Geode
749.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you. These geodes contain a wide variety of Minerals.

74.name: Prismatic Shard
74.description: A very rare and powerful substance with unknown origins.

298.name: Hardwood Fence
298.description: The most durable type of fence.

787.name: Battery Pack
787.description: It's fully charged with precious energy.

645.name: Iridium Sprinkler
645.description: Waters the 24 adjacent tiles every morning.

155.name: Super Cucumber
155.description: A rare, purple variety of sea cucumber.

137.name: Smallmouth Bass
137.description: A freshwater fish that is very sensitive to pollution.

693.name: Treasure Hunter
693.description: Fish don't escape while collecting treasures. Also slightly increases the chance to find treasures.

688.name: Warp Totem: Farm
688.description: Warp directly to your house. Consumed on use.

144.name: Pike
144.description: A freshwater fish that's difficult to catch.

814.name: Squid Ink
814.description: Squid use this ink to confuse would-be predators.

538.name: Alamite
538.description: Its distinctive fluorescence makes it a favorite among rock collectors.

409.name: Crystal Path
409.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

540.name: Baryte
540.description: The best specimens resemble a desert rose.

150.name: Red Snapper
150.description: A popular fish with a nice red color.

84.name: Frozen Tear
84.description: A crystal fabled to be the frozen tears of a yeti.

466.name: Deluxe Speed-Gro
466.description: Stimulates leaf production. Guaranteed to increase growth rate by at least 25%. Mix into tilled soil.

635.name: Orange
635.description: Juicy, tangy, and bursting with sweet summer aroma.

109.name: Ancient Sword
109.description: It's the remains of an ancient sword. Most of the blade has turned to rust, but the hilt is very finely crafted.

401.name: Straw Floor
401.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

458.name: Bouquet
458.description: A gift that shows your romantic interest.

560.name: Ocean Stone
560.description: An old legend claims these stones are the mosaics of ancient mermaids.

221.name: Pink Cake
221.description: There's little heart candies on top.

126.name: Strange Doll
sources: Tilling in The Mines or Skull Cavern

528.name: Jukebox Ring
528.description: Plays a random assortment of music you've heard.

800.name: Blobfish
800.description: This odd creature floats above the ocean floor, consuming any edible material in its path.

797.name: Pearl
797.description: A rare treasure from the sea.

694.name: Trap Bobber
694.description: Causes fish to escape slower when you aren't reeling them in.

136.name: Largemouth Bass
136.description: A popular fish that lives in lakes.

113.name: Chicken Statue
113.description: It's a statue of a chicken on a bronze base. The ancient people of this area must have been very fond of chickens.

452.name: Weeds
452.description: A cluster of dry old bushes.

808.name: Void Ghost Pendant
808.description: It's symoblic to the shadow people. As a gift, it signifies the desire to move in together as friends.

710.name: Crab Pot
710.description: Place it in the water, load it with bait, and check the next day to see if you've caught anything. Works in streams, lakes, and the ocean.

129.name: Anchovy
129.description: A small silver fish found in the ocean.

703.name: Magnet
703.description: Increases the chance of finding treasures when fishing. However, fish aren't crazy about the taste.

801.name: Wedding Ring
801.description: An old Zuzu City tradition... It's used to ask for another farmer's hand in marriage.

242.name: Dish O' The Sea
242.description: This'll keep you warm in the cold sea air.

556.name: Orpiment
556.description: Despite its high toxicity, this Mineral is widely used in manufacturing and folk medicine.

112.name: Rusty Cog
112.description: A well preserved cog that must have been part of some ancient machine. This could be dwarven technology.
sources: Tilling in The Mines or Skull Cavern

233.name: Ice Cream
233.description: It's hard to find someone who doesn't like this.

388.name: Wood
388.description: A sturdy, yet flexible plant material with a wide variety of uses.

261.name: Warp Totem: Desert
261.description: Warp directly to Calico Desert. Consumed on use.

138.name: Rainbow Trout
138.description: A freshwater trout with colorful markings.

141.name: Perch
141.description: A freshwater fish of the winter.

542.name: Calcite
542.description: This yellow crystal is speckled with shimmering nodules.

521.name: Warrior Ring
521.description: Occasionally infuses the wearer with "warrior energy" after slaying a monster.

548.name: Jamborite
548.description: The crystals are so tightly packed it almost looks fuzzy.

161.name: Ice Pip
161.description: A rare fish that thrives in extremely cold conditions.

64.name: Ruby
64.description: A precious stone that is sought after for its rich color and beautiful luster.

156.name: Ghostfish
156.description: A pale, blind fish found in underground lakes.

681.name: Rain Totem
681.description: Activate to greatly increase the chance for rain tomorrow. Consumed on use.

554.name: Lemon Stone
554.description: Some claim the powdered crystal is a dwarvish delicacy.

324.name: Iron Fence
324.description: Lasts longer than a stone fence.

680.name: Green Slime Egg
680.description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

719.name: Mussel
719.description: A common bivalve that often lives in clusters.

544.name: Esperite
544.description: The crystals glow bright green when stimulated.

636.name: Peach
636.description: It's almost fuzzy to the touch.

690.name: Warp Totem: Beach
690.description: Warp directly to the beach. Consumed on use.

405.name: Wood Path
405.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

158.name: Stonefish
158.description: A bizarre fish that's shaped like a brick.

775.name: Glacierfish
775.description: Builds a nest on the underside of glaciers.

535.name: Geode
535.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

574.name: Mudstone
574.description: A fine-grained rock made from ancient clay or mud.

561.name: Ghost Crystal
561.description: There is an aura of coldness around this crystal.

191.name: Ornate Necklace
191.description: A fancy necklace found in the water outside of the bath house. It's still wet...

117.name: Anchor
117.description: It may have belonged to ancient pirates.

411.name: Cobblestone Path
411.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

182.name: Large Egg
182.description: It's an uncommonly large brown egg!

118.name: Glass Shards
118.description: A mixture of glass shards smoothed by centuries of ocean surf. These could have belonged to an ancient mosaic or necklace.

413.name: Blue Slime Egg
413.description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

103.name: Ancient Doll
103.description: An ancient doll covered in grime. This doll may have been used as a toy, a decoration, or a prop in some kind of ritual.

165.name: Scorpion Carp
165.description: It's like a regular carp but with a sharp stinger.

120.name: Prehistoric Handaxe
120.description: One of the earliest tools employed by humans. This "crude" tool was created by striking one rock with another to form a sharp edge.

60.name: Emerald
60.description: A precious stone with a brilliant green color.

396.name: Spice Berry
396.description: It fills the air with a pungent aroma.

717.name: Crab
717.description: A marine crustacean with two powerful pincers.

386.name: Iridium Ore
386.description: An exotic ore with many curious properties. Can be smelted into bars.

403.name: Field Snack
403.description: A quick snack to fuel the hungry forager.

698.name: Sturgeon
698.description: An ancient bottom-feeder with a dwindling population. Females can live up to 150 years.

638.name: Cherry
638.description: It's popular, and ripens sooner than most other fruits.

171.name: Broken CD
171.description: It's a JojaNet 2.0 trial CD. They must've made a billion of these things.

114.name: Ancient Seed
114.description: It's a dry old seed from some ancient plant. By all appearances it's long since dead...

430.name: Truffle
430.description: A gourmet type of mushroom with a unique taste.

564.name: Opal
564.description: Its internal structure causes it to reflect a rainbow of light.

418.name: Crocus
418.description: A flower that can bloom in the winter.

407.name: Gravel Path
407.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

518.name: Small Magnet Ring
518.description: Slightly increases your radius for collecting items.

809.name: Movie Ticket
809.description: Admits one to the movie theater. Giving this to a friend invites them to the movies with you.

82.name: Fire Quartz
82.description: A glowing red crystal commonly found near hot lava.

115.name: Prehistoric Tool
115.description: Some kind of gnarly old digging tool.

578.name: Star Shards
578.description: No one knows how these form. Some scientists claim that the microscopic structure displays unnatural regularity.

104.name: Elvish Jewelry
104.description: Dirty but still beautiful. On the side is a flowing script thought by some to be the ancient language of the elves. No Elvish bones have ever been found.

587.name: Amphibian Fossil
587.description: The relatively short hind legs suggest some kind of primordial toad.

164.name: Sandfish
164.description: It tries to hide using camouflage.

368.name: Basic Fertilizer
368.description: Improves soil quality a little, increasing your chance to grow quality crops. Mix into tilled soil.

701.name: Tilapia
701.description: A primarily vegetarian fish that prefers warm water.

125.name: Golden Relic
125.description: It's a golden slab with heiroglyphs and pictures emblazoned onto the front.

726.name: Pine Tar
726.description: A pungent substance derived from pine sap.

687.name: Dressed Spinner
687.description: The metal tab and colorful streamers create an enticing spectacle for fish. Increases the bite-rate when fishing.

108.name: Rare Disc
108.description: A heavy black disc studded with peculiar red stones. When you hold it, you're overwhelmed with a feeling of dread.

119.name: Bone Flute
119.description: It's a prehistoric wind instrument carved from an animal's bone. It produces an eerie tone.

80.name: Quartz
80.description: A clear crystal commonly found in caves and mines.

279.name: Magic Rock Candy
279.description: A rare and powerful candy infused with the essence of the prismatic shard.

524.name: Ring of Yoba
524.description: Occasionally shields the wearer from damage.

571.name: Limestone
571.description: A very common type of stone. It's not worth very much.

702.name: Chub
702.description: A common freshwater fish known for its voracious appetite.

122.name: Dwarf Gadget
122.description: It's a piece of the advanced technology once known to the dwarves. It's still glowing and humming, but you're unable to understand how it works.

151.name: Squid
151.description: A deep sea creature that can grow to enormous size.

86.name: Earth Crystal
86.description: A resinous substance found near the surface.

329.name: Stone Floor
329.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

121.name: Dwarvish Helm
121.description: It's one of the helmets commonly worn by dwarves. The thick metal plating protects them from falling debris and stalactites.

124.name: Golden Mask
124.description: A creepy golden mask probably used in an ancient magic ritual. A socket in the forehead contains a large purple gemstone.

93.name: Torch
93.description: Provides a modest amount of light.

251.name: Tea Sapling
251.description: Takes 20 days to mature. Produces tea leaves during the final week of each season, except winter. No watering necessary!

634.name: Apricot
634.description: A tender little fruit with a rock-hard pit.

707.name: Lingcod
707.description: A fearsome predator that will eat almost anything it can cram into its mouth.

695.name: Cork Bobber
695.description: Slightly increases the size of your "fishing bar".

101.name: Arrowhead
101.description: A crudely fashioned point used for hunting.

170.name: Broken Glasses
170.description: It looks like someone lost their glasses. They're busted.

434.name: Stardrop
434.description: A mysterious fruit that empowers those who eat it. The flavor is like a dream... a powerful personal experience, yet difficult to describe to others.

723.name: Oyster
723.description: Constantly filters water to find food. In the process, it removes dangerous toxins from the environment.

751.name: Stone
751.description: There's copper ore in this stone.

565.name: Fire Opal
565.description: A rare variety of opal, named for its red spots.

747.name: Rotten Plant
747.description: Decomposing organic material. It's slimy and unpleasant.

543.name: Dolomite
543.description: It can occur in coral reefs, often near an underwater volcano.

575.name: Obsidian
575.description: A volcanic glass that forms when lava cools rapidly.

684.name: Bug Meat
684.description: It's a juicy wad of bug flesh.

668.name: Stone
668.description: There's stone ore in this stone.

127.name: Strange Doll
sources: Tilling in The Mines or Skull Cavern

186.name: Large Milk
186.description: A large jug of cow's milk.

722.name: Periwinkle
722.description: A tiny freshwater snail that lives in a blue shell.

18.name: Daffodil
18.description: A traditional spring flower that makes a nice gift.

323.name: Stone Fence
323.description: Lasts longer than a wood fence.

439.name: Purple Slime Egg
439.description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

2.name: Stone
2.description: A useful material when broken with the Pickaxe.

708.name: Halibut
708.description: A flat fish that lives on the ocean floor.

637.name: Pomegranate
637.description: Within the fruit are clusters of juicy seeds.

692.name: Lead Bobber
692.description: Adds weight to your "fishing bar", preventing it from bouncing along the bottom.

243.name: Miner's Treat
243.description: This should keep your energy up.

111.name: Rusty Spur
111.description: An old spur that was once attached to a cowboy's boot. People must have been raising animals in this area for many generations.
sources: Tilling in The Mines or Skull Cavern

419.name: Vinegar
419.description: An aged fermented liquid used in many cooking recipes.

691.name: Barbed Hook
691.description: Makes your catch more secure, causing the "fishing bar" to cling to your catch. Works best on slow, weak fish.

437.name: Red Slime Egg
437.description: Can be hatched in a slime incubator.

465.name: Speed-Gro
465.description: Stimulates leaf production. Guaranteed to increase growth rate by at least 10%. Mix into tilled soil.

130.name: Tuna
130.description: A large fish that lives in the ocean.

699.name: Tiger Trout
699.description: A rare hybrid trout that cannot bear offspring of its own.

96.name: Dwarf Scroll I
96.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a red bow.
sources: Tilling in The Mines or Skull Cavern

328.name: Wood Floor
328.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to decorate your floors.

123.name: Ancient Drum
123.description: It's a drum made from wood and animal skin. It has a low, reverberating tone.

563.name: Jasper
563.description: When polished, this stone becomes attactively luminous. Prized by ancient peoples for thousands of years.

720.name: Shrimp
720.description: A scavenger that feeds off the ocean floor. Widely prized for its meat.

369.name: Quality Fertilizer
369.description: Improves soil quality, increasing your chance to grow quality crops. Mix into tilled soil.

106.name: Ornamental Fan
106.description: This exquisute fan most likely belonged to a noblewoman. Historians believe that the valley was a popular sixth-era vacation spot for the wealthy.

689.name: Warp Totem: Mountains
689.description: Warp directly to the mountains. Consumed on use.

562.name: Tigerseye
562.description: A stripe of shimmering gold gives this gem a warm luster.

497.name: Fall Seeds
497.description: An assortment of wild fall seeds.

286.name: Cherry Bomb
286.description: Generates a small explosion. Stand back!

670.name: Stone
670.description: There's stone ore in this stone.

269.name: Midnight Carp
269.description: This shy fish only feels comfortable at night.

558.name: Thunder Egg
558.description: According to legend, angry thunder spirits would throw these stones at one another.

798.name: Midnight Squid
798.description: A strange and mysterious denizen of the ocean's twilight depths.

810.name: Crabshell Ring
810.description: The top of the ring is made from enchanted crab shell.

97.name: Dwarf Scroll II
97.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a green ribbon.

748.name: Rotten Plant
748.description: Decomposing organic material. It's slimy and unpleasant.

539.name: Bixite
539.description: A dark metallic Mineral sought after for its cubic structure.

206.name: Pizza
206.description: It's popular for all the right reasons.

293.name: Brick Floor
293.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to decorate your floors.

288.name: Mega Bomb
288.description: Generates a powerful explosion. Use with extreme caution.

537.name: Magma Geode
537.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

734.name: Woodskip
734.description: A very sensitive fish that can only live in pools deep in the forest.

774.name: Wild Bait
774.description: A unique recipe from Linus that gives you a chance to catch two fish at once.

526.name: Burglar's Ring
526.description: Monsters have a greater chance of dropping loot.

370.name: Basic Retaining Soil
370.description: This soil has a chance of staying watered overnight. Mix into tilled soil.

146.name: Red Mullet
146.description: Long ago these were kept as pets.

519.name: Magnet Ring
519.description: Increases your radius for collecting items.

812.name: Roe
812.description: Fresh fish eggs. These can be aged in a preserves jar to bring out more flavor.

557.name: Petrified Slime
557.description: This little guy may be 100,000 years old.

498.name: Winter Seeds
498.description: An assortment of wild winter seeds.

527.name: Iridium Band
527.description: Glows, attracts items, and increases attack damage by 10%.

621.name: Quality Sprinkler
621.description: Waters the 8 adjacent tiles every morning.

805.name: Tree Fertilizer
805.description: Sprinkle on a wild tree to ensure rapid growth, even in winter. Doesn't work on fruit trees.

569.name: Granite
569.description: A speckled Mineral that is commonly used in construction.

160.name: Angler
160.description: Uses a bioluminescent dangler to attract prey.

613.name: Apple
613.description: A crisp fruit used for juice and cider.

768.name: Solar Essence
768.description: The glowing face is warm to the touch.

139.name: Salmon
139.description: Swims upstream to lay its eggs.

423.name: Rice
423.description: A basic grain often served under vegetables.

577.name: Fairy Stone
577.description: An old miner's song suggests these are made from the bones of ancient fairies.

325.name: Gate
325.description: Allows you to pass through a fence.

22.name: Dandelion
22.description: Not the prettiest flower, but the leaves make a good salad.

732.name: Crab Cakes
732.description: Crab, bread crumbs, and egg formed into patties then fried to a golden brown.

414.name: Crystal Fruit
414.description: A delicate fruit that pops up from the snow.

253.name: Triple Shot Espresso
253.description: It's more potent than regular coffee!

390.name: Stone
390.description: A common material with many uses in crafting and building.

99.name: Dwarf Scroll IV
99.description: A yellowed scroll of parchment filled with dwarven script. This one's tied with a golden chain.

68.name: Topaz
68.description: Fairly common but still prized for its beauty.

110.name: Rusty Spoon
110.description: A plain old spoon, probably ten years old. Not very interesting.
sources: Tilling in The Mines or Skull Cavern

495.name: Spring Seeds
495.description: An assortment of wild spring seeds.

460.name: Mermaid's Pendant
460.description: Give this to the person you want to marry.

547.name: Helvite
547.description: It grows in a triangular column.

283.name: Holly
283.description: The leaves and bright red berries make a popular winter decoration.

550.name: Kyanite
550.description: The geometric faces are as smooth as glass.

522.name: Vampire Ring
522.description: Gain a little health every time you slay a monster.

566.name: Celestine
566.description: Some early life forms had bones made from this.

16.name: Wild Horseradish
16.description: A spicy root found in the spring.

686.name: Spinner
686.description: The shape makes it spin around in the water. Slightly increases the bite-rate when fishing.

333.name: Crystal Floor
333.description: Place on the ground to create paths or to spruce up your floors.

166.name: Treasure Chest
166.description: Wow, it's loaded with treasure! This is sure to fetch a good price.

716.name: Crayfish
716.description: A small freshwater relative of the lobster.

162.name: Lava Eel
162.description: It can somehow survive in pools of red-hot lava.

795.name: Void Salmon
795.description: A salmon, twisted by void energy. The fresh meat is jet black, but rapidly turns pink when exposed to air.

700.name: Bullhead
700.description: A relative of the catfish that eats a variety of foods off the lake bottom.

100.name: Chipped Amphora
100.description: An ancient vessel made of ceramic material. Used to transport both dry and wet goods.

163.name: Legend
163.description: The king of all fish! They said he'd never be caught.

167.name: Joja Cola
167.description: The flagship product of Joja corporation.

704.name: Dorado
704.description: A fierce carnivore with brilliant orange scales.

496.name: Summer Seeds
496.description: An assortment of wild summer seeds.

523.name: Savage Ring
523.description: Gain a short speed boost whenever you slay a monster.

772.name: Oil of Garlic
772.description: Drink this and weaker monsters will avoid you.

174.name: Large Egg
174.description: It's an uncommonly large white egg!

536.name: Frozen Geode
536.description: A blacksmith can break this open for you.

463.name: Drum Block
463.description: Plays a drum sound when you walk past.

715.name: Lobster
715.description: A large ocean-dwelling crustacean with a strong tail.

305.name: Void Egg
305.description: A jet-black egg with red flecks. It's warm to the touch.

422.name: Purple Mushroom
422.description: A rare mushroom found deep in caves.

281.name: Chanterelle
281.description: A tasty mushroom with a fruity smell and slightly peppery flavor.

245.name: Sugar
245.description: Adds sweetness to pastries and candies. Too much can be unhealthy.

807.name: Dinosaur Mayonnaise
807.description: It's thick and creamy, with a vivid green hue. It smells like grass and leather.

257.name: Morel
257.description: Sought after for its unique nutty flavor.

399.name: Spring Onion
399.description: These grow wild during the spring.

152.name: Seaweed
152.description: It can be used in cooking.

338.name: Refined Quartz
338.description: A more pure form of quartz.

88.name: Coconut
88.description: A seed of the coconut palm. It has many culinary uses.

340.name: Honey
340.description: It's a sweet syrup produced by bees.

296.name: Salmonberry
296.description: A spring-time berry with the flavor of the forest.

445.name: Caviar
445.description: The cured roe of a sturgeon fish. Considered to be a luxurious delicacy!

90.name: Cactus Fruit
90.description: The sweet fruit of the prickly pear cactus.

420.name: Red Mushroom
420.description: A spotted mushroom sometimes found in caves.

397.name: Sea Urchin
397.description: A slow-moving, spiny creature that some consider a delicacy.

459.name: Mead
459.description: A fermented beverage made from honey. Drink in moderation.

447.name: Aged Roe
447.description: Fish eggs aged in salt to bring out the flavor.

428.name: Cloth
428.description: A bolt of fine wool cloth.

259.name: Fiddlehead Fern
259.description: The young shoots are an edible specialty.

308.name: Void Mayonnaise
308.description: A thick, black paste that smells like burnt hair.

78.name: Cave Carrot
78.description: A starchy snack found in caves. It helps miners work longer.

277.name: Wilted Bouquet
277.description: A gift that shows you want to stop dating someone.

246.name: Wheat Flour
246.description: A common cooking ingredient made from crushed wheat seeds.

614.name: Green Tea
614.description: A pleasant, energizing beverage made from lightly processed tea leaves.

426.name: Goat Cheese
426.description: Soft cheese made from goat's milk.

393.name: Coral
393.description: A colony of tiny creatures that clump together to form beautiful structures.

395.name: Coffee
395.description: It smells delicious. This is sure to give you a boost.
